oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Five-year financial analysis of two commercial farms converting to organic: 2000-2005
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Robertson, J F
Daniel, C
Edwards, I E
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The financial performance including input and output costs were analysed for two commercial Scottish farms converting to organic production. A comparative analysis for a five year period is provided using data from the Scottish Farm Accounts scheme, and demonstrates that both conversions had positive financial outcomes. Both farms applied strategic changes to their businesses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Robertson, J F; Daniel, C and Edwards, I E (2006) Five-year financial analysis of two commercial farms converting to organic: 2000-2005. In: Atkinson, C; Ball, B; Davies, D H K; Rees, R; Russell, G; Stockdale, E A; Watson, C A; Walker, R and Younie, D (Eds.) Aspects of Applied Biology 79, What will organic farming deliver? COR 2006, Association of Applied Biologists, pp. 145-149.
